str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To enter secretly, come in by stealth. From para and a compound of eis and duno; to settle in alongside, i.e. Lodge stealthily.
Impious, ungodly, wicked. Irreverent, i.e. impious or wicked.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pro and grapho; to write previously; figuratively, to announce, prescribe.
Of old, long ago, in times past, former. Probably another form for palin; formerly, or sometime since; ancient.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From krino; a decision ('crime').

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From meta and tithemi; to transfer, i.e. transport, exchange, change sides, or pervert.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From a compound of a and a presumed selges; licentiousness.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.
And, even, also, namely.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
